content.title: Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm Surgical Indications
content.definition: Evidence-based criteria for operative intervention in thoracic aortic aneurysms, incorporating size thresholds, growth rates, genetic conditions, and patient-specific factors.

vascular_eds.rationale: Extreme tissue fragility, high operative mortality

turner_syndrome.rationale: Small body habitus - must index to BSA

content.statement: Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm Surgical Indications is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Thoracic-Aortic-Aneurysm that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm Surgical Indications helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm Surgical Indications include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm Surgical Indications.

learning_objectives: Apply size thresholds for TAA repair in different patient populations
Recognize genetic syndromes requiring lower intervention thresholds
Identify non-size indications for surgical repair
clinical_pearls: Loeys-Dietz patients should be operated on at 4.2-4.5 cm - more aggressive than Marfan
Always index aortic size to BSA in small patients (Turner syndrome, children)
When already doing cardiac surgery, lower the threshold for aortic repair
Rapid growth (>0.5 cm/year) is as important as absolute size
